page.title: 02BENENDEN WEALD, AMENITIES.
page.content: This block of grid squares must be one of those with the least amenities within 40 miles (65 km) of Charing Cross. It is served by only three bus services and some of these run only on a weekly basis, and the pubs and shops lie tantalisingly just outside the grid lines. Informal roadside selling is a marked feature of even the Nineveh Lane. Some "shops" are small, just a table with a few garden flowers or vegetables, others are larger selling fruit, eggs and dairy produce. There is not much pick-your-own as so many people have productive gardens and, because the roads cater only for local traffic there is little casual custom. There is one small factory and a furniture workshop otherwise people work in farming or outside the area.
